greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = phi(gpf(n)) - gpf(phi(n)) = A000010(A006530(n)) - A006530(A000010(n)).
comment: Value of commutator[A000010, A006530] at n.
example: Cases of n when a(n) = 1, -1, 2 or 0 are listed in A070002, A070003, A070004, A007283 respectively. Further regular solutions: if a(n)=3, then n=7k, where k has prime divisors < 7; if a(n)=5, then n=11k, where k has no prime divisors >=11; if a(n)=25, then mostly (not always!) n=31k ...
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, May 09 2002
